title: Cracked a tooth on a lobster? Poisoned by grouse? Watch out for these posh injuries...
text:
I cannot tell you which member of my family this story applies to because he’d be embarrassed, but my uncle went to the dentist the other day having cracked a tooth. The dentist asked how he’d managed that; my uncle replied that he’d eaten crab the previous evening and bitten down on a piece of shell. This was a fib. He’d eaten lobster, not crab, but, in these times of class antagonism, he couldn’t bring himself to say so. “Why didn’t he just say a toffee?” asked my sister, who argued that crab wasn’t much less posh than lobster. Well, we all panic when faced with the authorities, don’t we?

Mum came to stay with me in Norfolk last week and we laughed about this tale one evening while eating grouse....
description: I cannot tell you which member of my family this story applies to because he’d be embarrassed, but my uncle went to the dentist the other day having cracked a tooth.
